message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.NE. 

The paper discusses a new method that uses neural-network-based deep learning for holographic image reconstruction and phase recovery. This involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as image processing and pattern recognition, which fall under the cs.CV sub-category. The use of neural networks also suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), which are covered by the cs.AI sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of deep learning, which is a subset of ML and falls under the cs.LG sub-category. The technique could simplify imaging hardware and speed up image acquisition and reconstruction processes, which suggests the involvement of robotics (RO) and control systems. Finally, the paper discusses the application of the technique in various holographic and coherent imaging systems, which suggests the involvement of neural engineering (NE) and computational neuroscience.
